title: What is the general consensus about the “October Surprise” that Trump keeps talking about? - Quora

response.answer_text: Well, Trump thought that the “October Surprise" would be the Durham Report, which would reveal all sorts of criminal behavior from Clinton, Obama and Biden - only it did not reveal any criminal behavior, so Barr decided to hold it back lest the release of the report have the opposite of its intended affect and help Biden instead of Trump. You see, Trump is a Narcissist, which means he can’t really empathize with other people or understand what motivates them. Instead he thinks that everyone is exactly like he is - that they are willing to ignore ethics, morality and the law in order to get what they want. He quite literally cannot imagine that someone might be motivated by anything other than self-interest. In Trump’s world-view, every successful person has violated multiple laws, stepped on other people, cheated and lied to get where they are - they just hide their actions in order to fake “being good”. So, in Trump’s mind, Barack Obama, Joe Biden and Hillary Clinton must have committed a series of crimes in order to achieve what they did. So Trump set John Durham, the Attorney General for the District of Connecticut, to dig up and expose those crimes. Trump especially wanted proof that the Obama Administration had “spied on” or otherwise attacked the Trump Campaign in 2016. The Durham report was supposed to show that Obama, Biden and Clinton had committed multiple felonies; that Russia had NOT interfered with the 2016 election; that the Trump Campaign had no ties to Russia’s government; and that Joe and Hunter Biden had done illegal things in Ukraine. It was supposed to provide enough evidence for Bill Barr to indict Obama, Clinton and Hunter Biden - demonstrating that the Democrats were more corrupt than Trump and turning the tide of the election so that Trump would be reelected. And it did none of that, and Trump is absolutely furious. In Trump’s mind the evidence must be there because everyone is just as venal and corrupt as he himself is. To Trump the lack of evidence doesn’t mean that there was no crime - it means that his enemies merely hid their crimes better than he could. But Trump continues to behave as if the Durham Report said what he wanted it to say, and is calling for the indictment/ arrest of his political opponents - apparently not realizing that this sort of authoritarian behavior is actually causing him to lose votes. So that is what Trump’s “October Surprise” was supposed to be. The actual “October Surprise” was Trump catching Covid-19 and needing to be hospitalized for it. Despite all of his talk about being “cured” and “immune”, it is still fairly obvious that Trump is very ill and receiving treatment. He has band-aids from where the doctor’s have inserted IV lines, his voice is hoarse and he coughs and seems out of breath. A second “October Surprise” was the New York Times revealing details of Trump’s tax returns. These returns (which Trump has not disputed are his) show a man whose businesses are failing, who has used illegal tax dodges and who is deep in debt to foreign entities - debts which start coming due in just two years. So that is what Trump meant when he spoke about an “October Surprise” and that is what the “October Surprises” actually turned out to be.

I think the “October Surprise” is going to be that he doesn’t have an October Surprise, but he’ll pretend he does and it’s just so awesome, the Deep State says he’s not allowed to reveal it, even though he’s the president… that’s why he has to be reelected, so he can continue to fight the Deep State… and he’ll be sure to defeat them, if he knows he doesn’t have to worry about being reelected again… Because Trump is only a pretender at heart. He’s a cowardly child who likes to pretend he’s a hero, an insecure person who compensates by pretending he’s a bully, but only against those not strong enough to fight back, or not in a position to fight back. He’s President Walter Mitty, except that Walter was harmless guy who knew his limitations and kept his fantasies in his head. The last president we had like this was Nixon but when it mattered, in the 1973 Arab-Israeli war, Nixon’s Secretary of State Kissinger and his Chief of Staff Al Haig kept Nixon in Florida specifically to head off any “Walter Mitty” hysterics that Nixon might try to act out. Trump pretended to ace his SAT’s, while he paid someone else to take them; He pretended that he graduated “at the top of his class at Wharton”, when it’s clear that he didn’t even make Dean’s list that year, which meant he ranked no higher than 56 in a class of 338, so he was not in the top 10 per cent. He didn’t even crack the top 15 per cent. He just didn’t want to do the work to accomplish it. He pretended to have bone spurs to dodge the draft. He pretended to be a successful, shrewd real estate developer, but needed his father’s hundreds of millions of dollars to bail him out many times. He pretended to be a shrewd businessman, but every business he launched - steaks, the shuttle, the game, the vodka, the water, the magazine, casinos, the “university,” they all crashed and burned. All of them failed. Some were bad ideas, like the steaks, and the vodka, but some were good ideas, like the shuttle. He wanted to be successful, but he just didn’t want to do the work to accomplish it. So it all failed and went plumb to hell, but he pretended he was a success anyway. He pretended to be a great negotiator, but he usually wasn’t ever going to pay what he contracted to, and knew it. He was always negotiating in bad faith. He could have made good deals, but he didn’t want to sweat the details. He didn’t want to dot all his i’s and cross all his t’s. But he pretends to be a great negotiator anyway. He pretended to run a philanthropic foundation, but it was just a scam to attract donations, which he would spend on himself, or dole out for special favors; but he pretends to be a great philanthropist anyway. He pretended he wrote his autobiography, but it was ghost written. But he pretends to be a great writer anyway. He found his niche as a reality TV star, where everything is as sham and fake and done while the cameras are rolling, and stops when they’re shut off. He’s spent the last four years pretending to be the president. He really wanted to beat the pandemic. He wanted to be successful at it, but he just didn’t want to do the work to accomplish it. So it all failed and went plumb to hell, but he pretended he had a great success dealing with the pandemic anyway. He told the the factory workers in the rust belt States that he would bring their jobs back and companies are opening up factories there and hiring thousands. But they are not building factories there. But he’s pretending they are, anyway. He wanted to build thousands of miles of sturdy wall on the Mexico border and have Mexico pay for it. But he’s only built a few miles of fencing, and some of that falls down in a strong wind.. but he’s pretending he built a lot of it anyway. He wants to open the economy up fully, like other nations were doing. They did the work of a national shut-down, a national mask mandate, a national policy of social distancing and government assistance to all those for whom being unemployed for a few months would be a financial hardship; their medical needs, including home care, were always covered anyway. So Trump wants to reopen too, but he didn’t do the work of leading us through the hardships to be ready to do that. But he’s pretending he did, anyway. Now, he’s running a terrible campaign. He’s losing substantially in States where Republicans haven’t lost in a very long time. But he’s pretending that he’s running a great campaign anyway. So, he has no October surprise. Everything he had planned has failed, whether it was the Durham report, the Palestinian deal, repealing the ACA, arrests of Biden, Obama or Clinton, a Covid-19 vaccine. And he’s setting up for November, when he’ll lose the election… but he’ll be able to pretend he won anyway.
